title: Rare Sydney apartment up for sale for under $300k in prime location
text:
It is a Sydney real estate unicorn — a property sporting a price tag beginning with the number two.

Selling agent Nuri Shik of Laing and Simmons Potts Point has just listed an inner city apartment he says the owners would be willing to “let go at under $300,000”.

MORE: Elton John choose his Australian home base

Changing factors fuelling property market turnaround

“I’m expecting buyers to ask me ‘what’s the catch?’ but I guess you could say it’s a very particular apartment that’s not going to be for everyone.

It’s light-challenged and there isn’t an outlook. You’re pretty much just looking out to another building,” Mr Shik said.

“It is an entry-level studio — you won’t find cheaper than this,” he said of the unit which is marketed with a price range of between $295,000 and $324,000.

The 24sq m ground floor studio, however, does have its plus sides.

Located on Ward Ave in Potts Point, the pint-sized property is in the bustling heart of the Kings Cross district surrounded by eateries and is close to the train station, has a renovated kitchen, and looks great on paper.

It has most recently been rented out at $330 a week, a gross rental return of more than 5 per cent. “(That’s) really good for Sydney right now. To be honest, it’s a real cash cow,” Mr Shik said.

The median price of an apartment in the Greater Sydney area is $699,000, while the median for a unit in the Sydney council area, where the Potts Point unit is located, is $850,000, according to CoreLogic.

MORE: Ex-Giant seals move to Melbourne with sale

Bomera in Potts Point sells for $34 million

Banks have often shied away from issuing loans for properties under 40sqm but the high rental returns would solve this issue, Mr Shik said.

“It’s not too small to get finance, if you’ve got a big enough deposit of more than 20 per cent. So it would really depend on your lender and your personal circumstances when it comes to getting a loan,” Mr Shik said.

“It might even be a cash buyer who is looking at taking advantage of today’s market,” he added.

In an art deco block of 41, the unit has a gas kitchen with soft-close cabinetry, an original bathroom, a security intercom but no internal laundry. He is also selling a car space across the road for $110,000 for buyers keen to match the two.
description: It is a real Sydney real estate unicorn — a property sporting a price tag that is so low that it’ll knock you over. And wait until you see the location.
